Bartering: In the absence of currency, people would have to rely on bartering to exchange goods and services. This could lead to a shift in the economy towards more local and self-sufficient communities, as people would have to rely on their own skills and resources to trade

The rise of cryptocurrencies: As traditional forms of currency disappear, people may turn to cryptocurrencies as a way to exchange value. This could lead to the growth of decentralized financial systems, as people would no longer have to rely on central banks or governments to manage their finances.

The growth of alternative economies: Without traditional currency, people may turn to alternative economies such as gift or sharing economies. This could lead to a more collaborative and equitable society, as people would have to rely on each other to exchange goods and services.

The rise of the gig economy: Without traditional currency, people may turn to the gig economy as a way to exchange services. This could lead to a more flexible and entrepreneurial society, as people would have more control over their own work and income.

The collapse of the economy: If all forms of currency disappeared, it could lead to a collapse of the economy as we know it. This could lead to widespread poverty, social unrest, and political instability.
